body_html:
As a workaround you can use getattr() to get values. This always prints correct arguments.

    print 'Arguments:'
    for key in FLAGS.__flags.keys():
        print '  {}: {}'.format(key, getattr(FLAGS, key))
    print '===='
body_text:
As a workaround you can use getattr() to get values. This always prints correct arguments.
    print 'Arguments:'
    for key in FLAGS.__flags.keys():
        print '  {}: {}'.format(key, getattr(FLAGS, key))
    print '===='
body:
As a workaround you can use `getattr()` to get values. This always prints correct arguments.
```
    print 'Arguments:'
    for key in FLAGS.__flags.keys():
        print '  {}: {}'.format(key, getattr(FLAGS, key))
    print '===='
```
